body.p:
To His Excellency James F. Robiinson
Governor of the State of Kentucky
Dr Sir,
Without any preface or apology permit me to address you as an old acquaintance and friend of Michael Godard decd and of his family.

His son William W. Godard, residing in Mercer county, Ky., was arrested several months ago and taken to Camp Chase where he had been held a prisoner ever since. Mr. Godard never has known nor does he yet know at whose instance he was arrested nor on what charges.
The object I have in addressing you is to solicit your kind offices for his release or at least for a speedy trial to investigate such charges as were made the ground of his arrest.

Mr. G. has been in bad health for many years. He has a wife almost blind and several young children. Besides, his business is suffering from his absence. Whatever you can and may be pleased to do or suggest in his behalf, will be thankfully acknowledged by the family
as well as, Dr Sir, by

Your very obt servt
Henry Lenba
Should it be agreeable to you to appoint me to fill some office on your staff please consider me at your service.

H. Lenba
-- Covington
In behalf of W Goddard in (Camp Chase)
1862
